citeinfo.title: Perturbation Ratings: Eastern Brook Trout Joint Venture

attr.attrdef: Metadata code: Minimal quantification on how category decision was made for each watershed

edom.edomvd: Historical data greater than 10 years
Anecdotal (personal communication) knowledge only
Data and biologist interpretation
Collected quantifiable data only
Supportive habitat (elevation, water temp, pH, water quality)
Unknown

attr.attrdef: Indicates the presence of any exotic fish species. Value represents the most severe perturbation rating of all the species present.

edom.edomvd: High - eliminated life cycle component of brook trout somewhere in the watershed
Medium threat- reduced but not eliminated life cycle component of brook trout somewhere in the watershed
low threat - general threat or issue no known loss or reduction in life cycle component of brook trout in the watershed
threat not observed

overview.eaover: Each individual watershed has been evaluated by biologists for the presence of those perturbations, and if present those perturbations have been scored on a scale of 1 - 3 (1 being High: life cycle component eliminated, 2 - Medium: life cycle component reduced but not eliminated, or 3 - Low: general threat, no documented loss or reduction in life cycle component). This table is related to other tables in the EBTJV: allmetrics, ebtjv_subwatersheds, final_categories, model_results, node_prob_pruned, node_probabilities, perturb_biologists_ratings. The relationship is through the field called "HUC_CODE" (the unique HUC identification of the watershed).
overview.eadetcit: Perturbation categorizations and perturbation scores developed by Mark Hudy, U.S. Forest Service.

distinfo.distliab: No warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from the originator(s) of the data, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The distributor(s) shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
